firstDay.title: The Christoffel-Minkowski problems
firstDay.abstract: The classical Christoffel-Minkowski problem is an inverse problem of prescribed area measures, which is associated to the Minkowski sum for convex bodies. There are corresponding problems related to other settings, e.g., $p$-sum and mixed bodies. The $L^p$-Minkowski problem is a special case which has attracted extensive attention where Monge-Ampere equation plays key role. The other cases are more challenging and less understood, the main issue is the convexity of solutions to Hessian type fully nonlinear equations.  We will discuss some recent progresses and related open problems.

firstDay.title: Generic regularity of area-minimizing hypersurfaces in 9 and 10 dimensions
firstDay.abstract: I will discuss work with Christos Mantoulidis and Felix Schulze showing that area-minimizing hypersurfaces in 9 and 10 dimensions are generically smooth.

firstDay.title: Immortal solutions of the Kähler-Ricci flow
firstDay.abstract: I will discuss the problem of understanding the long-time behavior of Ricci flow on a compact Kähler manifold, assuming that a solution exists for all positive time. Inspired by an analogy with the minimal model program in algebraic geometry, Song and Tian posed several conjectures which describe this behavior. I will report on recent work (joint with Hein and Lee) which confirms these conjectures.

firstDay.title: Minimal hypersurfaces with cylindrical tangent cones
firstDay.abstract: I will discuss recent results on minimal hypersurfaces with cylindrical tangent cones of the form C x R, where C is a minimal quadratic cone, such as the Simons cone over S^3 x S^3. I will talk about a uniqueness result for such tangent cones in a certain non-integrable situation, a precise description of such minimal hypersurfaces near the singular set under a symmetry assumption, and a Liouville type theorem for minimal surfaces lying on one side of a C x R. Some of this is joint work with Nick Edelen.

secondDay.title: Stable minimal surfaces and applications
secondDay.abstract: I will discuss questions about stable minimal surfaces in Euclidean space and Riemannian manifolds, and give new perspectives and new results about manifolds with positive isotropic curvature.

secondDay.title: Metric SYZ conjecture
secondDay.abstract: The Strominger-Yau-Zaslow conjecture asks for the existence of special Lagrangian torus fibrations on Calabi-Yau manifolds near the large complex structure limit. I will discuss some recent progress on this, especially the case of the Fermat family of hypersurfaces.

secondDay.title: Systolic inequalities and the Horowitz-Myers conjecture
secondDay.abstract: Let $n$ be an integer with $3 <= n <= 7$, and let $g$ be a Riemannian metric on $B^2 	imes T^{n-2}$ with scalar curvature at least $-n(n-1)$. We establish an inequality relating the systole of the boundary to the infimum of the mean curvature on the boundary. As a consequence, we obtain a new positive energy theorem where equality holds for the Horowitz-Myers metrics. This is joint work with Pei-Ken Hung.
